abstract.p: Robert W Gundlach, 78, who is to be inducted into National Inventors Hall of Fame for his pionering work on xerography, says digital printers are simply an enhanced application of xerographic system (S)

block.p: Do you think xerography is as relevant in a time of digital printers as rotary dials are to a cellphone world? Don't tell Robert W. Gundlach, inventor of many of the fillips that put Xerox on the map. ''Digital printing is simply an enhanced application of the xerographic system,'' he said. ''And everyone stands on the shoulders of those who came before them, anyway.''

His metaphoric shoulders are about to be immortalized. Mr. Gundlach, 78, will be inducted into the National Inventors Hall of Fame in Akron, Ohio, in May, with Les Paul, for the electric guitar; Leo H. Sternbach, for Valium; Dean Kamen, for the AutoSyringe; and others. They will join the likes of Clarence Birdseye, Thomas Edison and, yes, Chester F. Carlson, the actual inventor of xerography.
